column4: do you know what it takes to get someone's attention in #pulseaudio or #alsa ?
Unfortunately, no.  Have you offered beer?
are you any good with sound? i have an odd problem but i have found a thread on it, though it doesn't resolve the problem i have remaining it does mention the problem

sorry, my sound-fu is pretty bad.  I had things working in 8.10, then I upgraded to 9.04 and things broke.  I'v stumbled through getting it more or less working, but some less importand programs are still having issues.
you know anyone who is good with sound?  maybe you could take a look at the thread?  i'm kinda lost because it mentions the issue but they didn't find a fix on that thread
My show's about to start.  mplayer /var/tv/BreakingBad_S01E04.avi
I've had bad luck with totem.  It may even be one of those apps that the sound doesn't work on.
I have an 800MHz clunker with 300Mb of RAM.  The less clutter I have the better.
Sweet!  I've been looking to upgrade.  What motherboard do you have?
actually it's a laptop.  vpcf115fm.  i'm not sure what board is in it actually
Oh, laptop.  Right.  When I see i7 I picture a CPU heat sink/fan about the size of my fist.
Really?  I'll have to actually look at one instead of looking at the tricked out, light up, heat pipe, liquid cooled demonstrator.  Anyways, what problem are you having with the sound?
it use to only work via headphones/plugin mic
sorry, nothing is coming to mind.  You do have them unmuted, right?
yes, let me show you a link that explains, maybe you'll have an idea for me.  http://code.google.com/p/vaio-f11-linux/issues/detail?id=9#c1
I followed a few links off of the link you sent me.  If I'm reading it right, it looks like you have to patch the kernel to get the mic/line in working.
what kernel patch do i need?  i never found that
See comment #5 on https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/alsa-driver/+bug/525149
this is going to sound stupid.  how do you run a patch?
I think a .patch file is actually a script that patches things.
should i just chmod and sh it?
I know less about patching kernels than I do about sound.  I think so, but hey!  Huge grain of salt here.  You could seriously damage things.

i found http://code.google.com/p/vaio-f11-linux/wiki/EnableMicrophone that says to patch the kernel and explains why it's necessary....but it doesn't say how to patch.... and it says something about rebuilding....
